application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: ERECTION OF A NEW ROOF OVER THE EXISTING HOUSE, INCLUDING SINGLE-STOREY REAR EXTENSION INCLUDING POOL AND NEW SINGLE-STOREY GARDEN STUDIO.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Drawing no. (Existing Site Plan) 
Drawing no. (Proposed Site Plan)
Drawing no: (Proposed Location Plan) 
Drawing no; (Proposed Ground Floor & Proposed First Floor Plans) 
Drawing no:(Proposed North, South, East& West Elevations Plans) 
Design and Access Statement (27MR- DAS_Rev B) Dated 10th March 2023

Condition : 3 - Materials to be Approved - No development shall take place until details of particulars and samples of the materials to be used on all external faces of the development hereby permitted, including window frames and doors (notwithstanding any materials specified in the application form and/or the approved drawings), have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. No works which are the subject of this condition shall be carried out until the details are approved, and the development shall be carried out in full accordance with the
approved details.

Condition : 4 - Ancillary Residential Accommodation - The new single storey garden room and small pool development as proposed on the south west corner of the property hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as  27 Marryat Road, Wimbledon, SW19 5BE.

Condition : 5 - Tree Protection - The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'BS5837 Arboricultural Method Statement' reference 'AC.2023.170' and dated '24 May 2023' and drawing number 'TPP-01 Rev.A' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works.

Condition : 6 - Site Supervision (Trees) - The details of the approved 'BS 5837 Arboricultural Method Statement' shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to monitor and report to the Local Planning Authority not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the demolition and site works. A final Certificate of Completion shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority at the conclusion of all site works. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan

Condition : 7 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the circular windows in the north and west elevations at first floor level shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 8 - Construction Times - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 9 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
